{"step_by_step_thinking": "Maraviroc is a CCR5 antagonist used in the treatment of HIV-1 infection. It works by blocking the CCR5 co-receptor on the surface of the host's T cells, preventing the virus from entering the cell. The gp120, gp160, p24, and reverse transcriptase are all components of the HIV virus itself, not the host's cells. Therefore, none of these options are correct.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
